website_summaries.verdict: Enhance the sound to a powerful new level from most home audio equipment for an immersive listening experience.
pros: Can deliver up to 1,000W of power at times, with 500 continuous watts
cons: Some reports of duds or defects, so set up soon after delivery in case you need to return it

customer_reviews.title: Product not returnable!
customer_reviews.text: buyer beware. Despite these saying they are on Prime, these speakers are not returnable. I am within my 30 day return window and Amazon will not take them back. I was referred to the manufacturer, but no response from them so far. If an item is not returnable, it really should be clearly stated. My speakers have no sound so are not usable and so far I have not been able to have the return accepted.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Good BUT!!!!! They are defective no matter what!!  DO NOT BUY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So they are fairly good speaker sound system, but be warned they last about 5 months (ya know long enough so that you cannot return them). After that they start doing a crack and pop sound, you can reset them but after a while they eventually just stop working all together. SO MY ADVICE...LOOK ELSEWHERE!!! This is a known issue but Logitech will do NOTHING about it so just do NOT buy these UPDATE: Logitech will NOT warranty these ..period. Do not try to if you are having the reset loop issue. These speakers are LEMONS and Logitech knows it.
customer_reviews.author: Dark_Admin

customer_reviews.title: This product does not work. Sound doesn't play. ...
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work. Sound doesn't play. I am not allowed to return it even less than a week after buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not happy.  $300 down the drain.
customer_reviews.text: Item defective, Amazon won't take it back because they consider it "hazardous" and Logitech support is a black hole. I sent them multiple emails with no response. Don't waste your money or time.
customer_reviews.author: Matt White

customer_reviews.title: It will eventually fail you.
customer_reviews.text: Looking at many other reviews, these units just fail. There is no durability and it's a crap shoot as to how long your's will continue to work. Mine is back in the box after I wasted 2+ hours upgrading from a single input unit. A previous multi input Logitech unit also failed. Looking at the reviews, people are reporting multiple replacements that continue to fail, coupled with lengthy turn around time. At this point, I can only conclude that build quality is a systemic problem with Logitech. Whether they are cutting the corners in the design, or the manufacturer is using marginal parts, is immaterial at this point, as they've lost their reputation with me.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Be sure
customer_reviews.text: Had I known this wasn’t eligible for return I’d have never bought it. It simply will not pair with my TV, now I’m stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: James Dale McSwain Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Another masterpiece from Logitech 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Another masterpiece from LOGITECH 👍 Got this for my friend to replace his old-school Onkyo analog big bulky sound system. Optical digital inputs THX certified and Dolby Digital Compliance Well made and all material feels rich and quality For the price, there is no other competitor for this quality of material and sound Amazing sound quality, clear, well toned and plenty of effects and options just makes it amazing. Games and dts movies are now much enjoyable and realistic. Definitely recommend Z906 for anyone looking for a best budget top notch quality. It will compete head to head woth bose or harman kardon easily. Definitely win on the price point.
customer_reviews.author: yalch⭐

customer_reviews.title: They did not say that  you had to buy an extra part to actually make it work.
customer_reviews.text: They did not say that you had to buy an extra part to actually make it work and be bluetooth as advertised. I was excited to hook it up tonight, but I can not because the company did not tell me that you had order an additional part to be able to use it. I f I do not hear from someone buy tomorrow morning I will film a video about all of this and put it up online.
customer_reviews.author: Sven

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  sound system
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my theater room. I am not made of money so I bought this one. I could not be more pleased. The surround sound quality is excellent. I would like a little more bass but I really can't complain. I am sure there are better systems out there but this was plug and play and I am not super knowledgeable about speaker systems and I am not made of money. If you but it I doubt you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Beware what you are buying
customer_reviews.text: Got delayed hooking this up. Mounted speakers on wall for pre-wired media room. Noticed that the subwoofer did not have same plug as wall. Then discovered that the speakers hook into the subwoofer at the back of the room. The room is wired for the front of the room. Went to Best Buy and they said that it is garbage and only good for a computer. I wasted my money. Not a happy customer! The writeup says for a TV. I highly disagree.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce H.

customer_reviews.title: Any volume is completely satisfying!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these speakers and I've been through a good amount in the past. The set up (sound adjustment wise) is very easy and I can make adjustments to bass to varying music types effortlessly. I'm in a small apartment room and these at low volume sound excellent because even though the bass might be turned all the way down the size of the sub allows you to hear that perfect note. No matter where you live these will serve any purpose. Days you want to rock out, turn up the bass and hope your house doesn't literally fall apart from vibration. Best $250 on speakers I have ever spent in my life. Ever!
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Logitech speaker system I have purchased that has completely failed to operate within the first year. The system will not turn off, and overheats very easily if you do not unplug from source when not using. Mine will not turn off at all, and shows 3 or 4 lights on in the Input bars, but cannot change inputs, or control anything other than powering it off (which it then turns itself back on), and the 8 second reset which does nothing. Trash.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, damaged on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Product had a nice weight to it, and the sub definitely had power - if you’re looking for strong and powerful bass, look no further. However, the music quality was... sub par in general. For someone that enjoys Pink Floyd, Ratatat, and Mumford, it’s really important to have high quality tweeters. I did not find that with this product. Mine was also damaged on arrival - that may have some bearing over the result. Hopefully other purchasers had a better experience. I returned my set.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit fake received. Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Update, turns out Logitech has gone from a number one brand to a number x Chinese brand. Earlier.... thought it was a fake..... Returning for exchange / refund. Check thbe box for a genuine logitech logo and color print doesn't match. Seems way to crap to be genuine. Upon closer inspection I noticed the name isnt even Logitech. Scamer should be banned from amazon
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Z906 has a lot of power for the money.
customer_reviews.text: At the moment I can not think of anything bad about the Logitech Z906. This is replacing my old RCA Stereo surround that only decoded Dolby. I never really listen to the radio in the living room so the consideration over a radio vs a THX surround system that decode DTS as well as Dolby made this an no brainier. I have my PS4 and my 3D Blu ray both running into it. I am hearing things I never heard before, and it is LOUD.
customer_reviews.author: Film and music buff

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It is important to know that if any of the speakers are it working, removing the power connection ad removing all of the connections will RESET the system. The right rear speaker did not work until I did this (customer service at Amazon did not advise this on the initial call, but the subsequent three days later they did. As promised I removed the negative review and replaced it today. The sound is very good and I am once again a satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Kharm

customer_reviews.title: Nice 5.1
customer_reviews.text: Had to retire my old Z-5500 system as it developed a nasty buzz from the sub. Tried a stereo system after that and it just sounded empty like a hole in the room after being used to 5.1 for years. Since the Z-5500 has been discontinued for years now, I decided on the Z906 which was the closest thing to it. Very happy I did. Speakers are an improvement as well as the remote and console. Sub is an 8" where the Z-5500 was a 10" but the bass still fills my room quite nicely. Pretty happy with this purchase. For the quality of this system, it has no equal in it's price range. Logitech nailed it on this one.
customer_reviews.author: MLO

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with these so far! 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Really liking these so far. Ive bought and sold several logitech systems. I still have an older smaller system that i love. I owned the z5500 and wasnt totally in love with it. This puts out quite a bit more bass from a slightly smaller sub box. You can adjust all the levels using the remote or on the center control console. Sound quality is excellent and when it gets loud it might even get better if thats possible? Really impressed so far 👍 ill update my review if anything changes. Btw, youll need to buy bolts if you want to mount these as the kit comes with no mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.author: TTuckF

customer_reviews.title: Don't think there is a better PC sound system
customer_reviews.text: +Unbelievable bass. It shakes the entire house. +Clean looks. Nothing flashy. +Many inputs, many options. +Plugged using SPDIF into my EVGA NU Audio. Absolutely fantastic. -Slight popping noise when starting/stopping media going over SPDIF. Not a big enough issue to care about, though. If you want a great plug-and-play PC stereo system, this is it. The only way you can get anything better...buy a receiver and create a DIY sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Brillis

customer_reviews.title: No Sound - 2 Input Lights - 6 Months Use
customer_reviews.text: Well, they were great while they worked. Unfortunately, after 6 months, they quit on me. That's pretty disappointing given the price. No warranty, and no support. Time to move on from Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Karter

customer_reviews.title: this is the one
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT spend $1000 on a surround. Spend $300 and be very happy. I got mine for $279. The price fluctuates, so grab it now while it's at the bottom. I know it's getting on in years. I bought it and it satin the corner, I was supposed to be moving. I hooked it up this weekend. It was a massive upgrade from a, not so bad, setup. When they say "room filling", they mean "room filling"
customer_reviews.author: T. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Inputs are not isolated, unit not grounded properly
customer_reviews.text: After getting a replacement for ground loop hum on all analog inputs I realized it was related to a single input that was affecting all inputs! How could you not have better isolation of your inputs!? Sounds is quite good, I held onto the unit because the desktop savings of having the amp inside the subwoofer was my main need. Just be careful if you need the analog inputs. I had to buy a whole bunch of ground loop isolators to make it work. They clearly cut some corners here compared to my z5500 once upon a time.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.  Don't waste your money on this!
customer_reviews.text: This product died only after 3 months of use. I paid $283.00 for trash. Logitech support is non-existent. I should have known better. Now all I get are the three input lights 4, 5, and 6 lit up and no sound. Factory resetting it by holding down the the input button for 8+ seconds does not fix it. What a waste of money... If you are eyeing this product, I would recommend buying any 2.1 or 5.1 receiver and get yourself some decent monitor speakers with a sub. Yea it may cost a little more, but it won't die on you and will sound better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: The sound is top notch. One small issue is I get a popping noise when the input coding changes. For example: scrolling through Netflix and the output changes to surround for the content selected. A small annoyance that my old Sony home theater system did not have. However, during normal use, the sound is of very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J

customer_reviews.title: Nice sounding for the place.
customer_reviews.text: Ah yes, all my previous reviews come down to these, the ones for wires, converters, etc. For PC speakers, these are a nice set for inexpensive speakers. They fit the room nicely, look nice, and sound nice for the place. I'm sure I can get way better, but at what cost? I like the remote as I don't always have to get up all the time to change volume, switch the features. They have multiple inputs for my PC's, and the TV, which is nice, so all I do is have a couple remotes, keyboards, and mice, and I can sit on the couch controlling the multiple electronic toys at my command. Device flipping has met it's match.
customer_reviews.author: W. Heller

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend these to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't post anything when i purchase a product. Idk why but i don't. I had to with these. These aren't even tuned in yet cuz i've had them 2 days. But by far the best bang for your money. These speakers rock. I highly recommend to anyone. You will need to know how to set them up properly thru comp but they are awesome. Great sound great price. I grabbed these on the daily deals for 199.99 best purchase i could've made.
customer_reviews.author: Todd D.

customer_reviews.title: Best value in surround sound!
customer_reviews.text: I have these set up in a home theater. A legit home theater with Epson 5040UB projector and 110" fixed screen. I think the sound might be my favorite part of my set up, even though it was one of the least expensive parts. I can't tell the difference between this and theatrical sound. The ability to control the volume of the front vs back vs sub is really easy and helpful. I'm very happy I went with this for $250 instead of the BOSE set up for $4-5k. Incredible value!
customer_reviews.author: Ollie Williams

customer_reviews.title: Thump Thump Thump Thump
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a set of Z560's with these. Those lasted about 15 year and I was sad to see them go. These Z906's are just as loud, if not louder. Bass thumps the room and the surround sound added an interesting touch to games and movies. My only (very small) complaint is the control box. It's large. The speaker lights that light up on the right of it seem to light up more than they should. Since the control box sits under the screen, that tends to catch my eye when it flicks on and off. But this is a pretty minor complaint to the purpose of the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great for the money, easy setup. Its short comings are it does not have an adjustable EQ or any HDMI ports. The other factor to consider when buying is the subwoofer has all the connections and the amp built in so you can't place your sub anywhere it must be within about 6ft of the control unit additionally and your optical cable is also going from your tv/monitor to your sub not the control unit. This may or may not be a problem depending on your room layout and cable management. Overall it is a fantastic value sounds great. Dont forget to buy an optical cord it is not included.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a Logitech speaker system before and it functioned so perfectly that when it got destroyed by hurricanes Irma and Maria, I decided to go the same route and stick with the same brand. Sure there may be louder and possibly even better systems out there, but I do some occasional gaming and movies from time to time and this system is perfect on all levels for what I need in my book. All my games come to life with the rumbling bass and THX certified speakers. Look no further if you are looking for excellent sound at an excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: Robelto H. Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Worth the chance
customer_reviews.text: I've been a poor audiphile for decades. I bought a Klipsh 5.1 around 2000 on clearance. It worked well until the distortion started to gradually climb. Time to replace, I bought the THX certified Logitech. WOW! Yep, unbelievable difference. Clean, crisp, thunder powered, no warranty issues. Worth twice the price, six months on. BTW: 5 Star reviews are reserved for drama queens, people whose life's were inextricably alterered, and liars.
customer_reviews.author: Denise C

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great! Needs speaker mounts.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first surround sound system, so I have nothing to compare it with. It sounds great, I love it. However, it comes without speaker wall mounts. I found a set of mounts which works out great. Brand name is "VideoSecu". Model number MS40B6.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Flesher

customer_reviews.title: The sound is mindblowing
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my gaming rig in my office and they are louder than my Yamaha avr system! The bass makes my mouse move by itself. Pisses off the neighbors who like to turn up their music. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Techieferret

customer_reviews.title: FEEL THE POWER!
customer_reviews.text: Whether you just like to listen to music or you are a major gamer, this is what you are looking for. It can be set quiet and simple, or so loud that you will shake the foundation of your house! Great speakers! P.S. I played the 1812 overture on these things at full power and my neighbors called to see if I was ok........that song calls for multiple cannon shots.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Great sound at affordable price. Backplate gets very hot.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with these speakers especially with the 24 hour sale price I got them at. I have them paired with a SB ZXR and using 16g copper wire instead of the wire it comes with. Using both optical and analog from the sound card to the speakers. There is a difference in the sound quality between the optical and analog. The optical sounds cripser and has a cleaner sound (which is to be expected). They still sound great on analog regardless. I am concerned a little with the heat coming off the backplate. I've owned several receivers over the years that also got very hot. We'll see how well the Logitech electronics hold up.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Best sound system I've found for PC
customer_reviews.text: This is the most accurate-sounding system I've found for a PC. I was having issues matching my recording productions EQ when recording and during playback. This allows me to make a final master that exactly matches what I hear during creation and will match what I hear in a final product listening on several different platforms. I've spent much more and got much less. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Edward Staszko

customer_reviews.title: Great system, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit to set up our living room, mainly due to the wall mount install (which I highly recommend adding if you have the wall space) but the actual system install was very easy and this system is great! We just watched Avengers: Infinity War and the 5.1 was really shown off throughout the movie. I will add that we had to adjust some levels for the subwoofer, satellite and center speakers during the movie but once we found the right levels, it was a great ride! For those that asked in the questions, you can adjust volume levels for the center, subwoofer, and rear channels individually or as a group.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Coe

customer_reviews.title: Great audio!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use with my five-year-old desktop PC. I sit at the computer hours at a time and always listen to music. This really gives me "surround sound." Very easy to connect and get setup. Was able to purchase it for a great price reduction during a sale. It really beats the sound from my formerly three-piece speaker setup. Always had high regard for Logitech products, as I own many, many of them!
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Just WOW
customer_reviews.text: I am truly blown away with this system. I am a car and home audio guy and this just blows me away the quality you get for under $300! Make sure you put the subs port facing a wall preferably about 3-5 inches away from the wall and it just makes the movies. Using this for a home theater and it's perfect. I dont even have to go above 50% and I like my movies loud. Have the speakers turned down and this is just extremely impressive. Wish it had more connections and setting options but it's not a $1200 system with a real receiver but the speakers sound the same quality as the $1200 systems.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent system, excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this system. For the space we bought it for, about 12'x10', it is perfect. Movies, games, tv all sound great. The dog freaks out and barks at animal sounds if that is any indication of quality for you. It gets loud, but not too loud, and doesn't distort. Setup and controls were super easy. The only bad thing was we had to buy an optical cable for the system as it wasn't clear in the details we would need one. So we had to wait a week before actually using it. But after having for a couple of months, we are very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L.

customer_reviews.title: 2.1 i can never go back.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: surround sound is great, crystal clear and subwoofer really hits harder than my previous Logitech 2.1 Z-2200 (14 years running since 2004). Its pretty well put together, the settings, the outputs and slick design, easy setup. Sounds great on my blu-ray movies and video games especially (far cry 5, Fallout 4) Cons: none so far. purchased the 4 year warranty incase they fail. Overall: I highly recommend these bad boys, but i wouldn't recommend running the sound quality off your PCs motherboard, integrated onboard sound isn't great. I'm still using a Creative Labs Soundblaster X-FI Fatal1ty (THX certified) that i got 10 years ago, still running great with sound.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Sound!
customer_reviews.text: Combined with the 65" uhd TV and 49" Qled PC Monitor, turned my Living Room into an IMAX Theater! The quality is AMAZING, Completely Immersive, with the Sub under my Desk, center just below the tv screen, and a speaker in each corner of the room, Really feels like you're "in" the movie, or game. And Music? BLOWS YOU AWAY! No distortion at ALL, even up to 80% volume, and at 1000W, that is LOUD! I mean Rock-Concert-Loud! For the Price, it doesn't get any better than this.
customer_reviews.author: paul mitchell

customer_reviews.title: That sub though!
customer_reviews.text: The subwoofer is INCREDIBLE. I would recommend having it at 50% and everything else at full, but that's cause it's a little too bassy and you can't hear anything else otherwise. If you're just watching TV, nothing big, I would but it at about %30 otherwise it heats up the entire room really fast. Other than that, the sound quality is nice, needs more mid, voices kind sound washed out when music is playing but only a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Carey

customer_reviews.title: A great product
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my makeshift surround sound system using my computers various output ports and simplify it was optical audio, the overall sound is amazing especially when playing shooting games like borderlands 3 and hearing bullets shoot by my head. I realized after a couple of days I could plug in my switch via the headphone jack while it was docked and connected to my monitor. It made it much easier to find skulltullas in hyrule warriors. Overall the unit is amazing and powerful. Only con is probably the lack of built in bluetooth connectivity but for me it's not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Cap'n Pantless

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang for Buck
customer_reviews.text: You get a lot for your money with these speakers. I've never been disappointed in a Logitech product and this is no exception. There are not many 5.1 systems out there any more, it seems, and I needed to replace a Klipsch system that finally died. I am very pleased with the sound, even when cranked up fairly loud. I also like the remote - very easy to scroll through things.
customer_reviews.author: CTT

customer_reviews.title: Kicks a%# !!!!!  He#l yeah!
customer_reviews.text: YES! I have purchased several sound systems over the years and this one will definitely get the cops called on you, not so much the volume, but the Bass. If you live in an apartment you're 'going' to get complaints, ALOT because of the bass & u cant change it. Lack of bass has always been my biggest problem, finding something with powerful Bass to really put that PUNCH into movies & music. This Is It! Check out the band, 'heilung,' once you get the system and listen to the bass, it will blow your mind! Doesn't take up any space either. DIME SOUNDS AWESOME ON IT!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Nice, affordable alternative upgrade to my ancient old z5500s
customer_reviews.text: Was on sale for only $250 or $260 so I couldnt pass it up. I was missing my remote for my z5500s and also had a broken control pod, so I figured I'd just upgrade and get this system for cheap. The new control pod works perfectly, and there's no need for LCD display. I also love that the sub weighs a ton less because it has no massive heat sink on the back. It also has TWO optical outputs which is amazing! Got so tired of having to switch my single optical to different consoles, so now I can have two things hooked up all the time. Overall, very well worth the low price I got this for.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Eh, I painted them white, super happy with results.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are great, sound is amazing, bass rattles the floor with my house, we have a little crawl space under neither so you can hear the kids running g around and all that. This completely overrides all other sounds. Even on high volume they still sound great. Movies are awesome to watch also now.
customer_reviews.author: Johnni

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and wonderful value
customer_reviews.text: If you need to add 5.1 sound to your multimedia PC or gaming console, this is your best option for the price. Sure you could do better and go out and buy a Yamaha receiver and spend even more than this whole package and still have no speakers at all. If you want something better, be prepared to spend triple at the very least. I've only ever turned it up half-way and that's as loud as I can stand it. Clarity is awesome. Bass is not too boomy, just right. Treble is good enough. Center channel is just right, doesn't over power the rest of the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Voracious_Reader

customer_reviews.title: Two speaker ports on the subwoofer don't work. Pay for 5 speakers, get 3 working ones!
customer_reviews.text: Neither of the two front speaker ports on the subwoofer work. Any speaker connected to any of the other ports work. Basically, pay for a 5.1 system and get a 2.1 system. It's a great deal! Update: I got a free replacement for sending back the old one within the same week with free shipping. The replacement arrived in June 2019. It is now February 2020 and the replacement has 3 broken, unresponsive speakers. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Y.

customer_reviews.title: LOGITECH makes soundsystems now .. apparently ..  .. and they are A W E S O M E . . .
customer_reviews.text: BOSE should be genuinely terrified. Logitech's 5.1 sound-system is hands-down THE BEST setup i've ever had. I mean, this thing is clear, loud and will shake anything that isn't nailed down (and some that ARE nailed down) Clear sound, thumping bass that punches you square in the goolies and a satisfying control-unit with IR remote make this thing a MUST-HAVE for anyone. TL;DR "HOLY SH**, LOGITECH MAKES SYSTEMS NOW... and they're GOOD..." UPDATE: Speakers pop after 10 minutes of use. Unsure if it's the motherboard or the amp in the woofer.. No one seems to have an answer. It looks like i'll be doing some circuit diag work. ..unfortunate..
customer_reviews.author: Skirnir

customer_reviews.title: I am not a sound system guy at all so believe me when I say the adjustments were easy to figure out
customer_reviews.text: Built a cinema room and used this system for the surround sound. If you are looking for an all in one package that has little set up this is it. The only thing I needed outside of what came with the system was a 3.5mm male to RCA male cable to connect to my Epson 2150 projector. Multiple settings that you can tweak with but nothing extravagant. Its all strait forward and you can adjust the front and rear speakers overall volume along with the sub volume independently or as a whole system. I am not a sound system guy at all so believe me when I say the adjustments were easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product dead on arrival. Not sure how it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Product dead on arrival. Not sure how it is rated so well. There is a common problem with the control unit. Amazon was very helpfull in resolving the issue
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Shaw

customer_reviews.title: 2016 to 2020 no problems
customer_reviews.text: Figured I'd do my due diligence and give this a long term review. I bought these in 2016 and have carried them around with me for about 4 moves now. I've had no issues whatsoever. Sound quality is great, the small remote is simple and useful for when on the treadmill or wherever. I got them on a deal back then for $250, so at or around that price i'd definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon & Bailey

customer_reviews.title: So close to perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound of the system and it has plenty of power. The speaker wires for the back two had enough to wrap around the room to connect to the farthest one away without difficulty. My one complaint is the three wire connection between the sub and the computer is just too short.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Impressed to say the least
customer_reviews.text: I have listened to and built a lot of surround systems in my days. This simple system is by far the best sounding system you can buy for the money. I had a dennon and full infinity kappa system with a marantz amp that I replaced with this system because my wife didn't like the how much room the tower speakers and entertainment system used up. She said it looked like it belonged in a bachelor pad. Lol The sound quality of this small inexpensive system is unbelievable. It even has digital optical inputs. I'm a self proclaimed audiophile and would say I don't think you'll ever find a system as good as this for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha

customer_reviews.title: BROKE EXACTLY ONE YEAR LATER
customer_reviews.text: Sounded great for the price...until literally 1 week after the warranty expired the front right speaker output stopped working. Not the speaker mind you (that would be easily replaceable), the speaker OUTPUT on the amp. So now I have only Mono sound. For shame :(
customer_reviews.author: Korey

customer_reviews.title: Do not waiste your money, garbage!
customer_reviews.text: These will eventually fail. They worked for around 1 year then the center channel failed then the 2 front channels failed, the only two channels left were the 2 rear and subwoofer. Then the digital settings sp/dif and coaxial became muddy and distorted. So I junked them but not before I tore them apart, The construction of this products is horrible, bad soldering. cheap internals like the DSP and amp among others. THX rating is available to anyone willing to pay for it. For around the same price I bought the Edifier S350 DB's and wow ,that baby blows the Logitechs out of the water, make no mistake I bought the Edifiers around a year ago have not looked back.
customer_reviews.author: jeff wilks

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound system that has stood the test of time
customer_reviews.text: I bough this system in 2014 for my PC and it's been in use every single day since. Over two thousand days later it still functions like the day I bought it. Powerful clear sound, highly adjustable output right from the controller on my desk. I can't say enough great things about this system. I'm not sure what's happened with the reviewers that have had problems but this one is absolutely a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Shane M

customer_reviews.title: Other thx speakers cost 1500$, these met the same very high standards. The inputs are a turd tho.
customer_reviews.text: Buy it for the speakers alone, later add a thx certified receiver. None of the inputs except the 6 channel direct are capable of anything but compressed 5.1 audio(that's a computer port only) , for example you can't get 5.1 out of The Nintendo switch because it only supports uncompressed 5.1 and the digital inputs on here can only do 2 channel uncompressed. ARC can only pass down compressed 5.1 as well. BUY FOR THE SPEAKERS SOUND ONLY, it'll need a real receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Sean L. Mullins

customer_reviews.title: low quality stuff, don't buy
customer_reviews.text: well kept and rarely used, the center channel dead after 18 month.
customer_reviews.author: shumin.li

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the budget home theater
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my home theater, and the sound is fantastic. I know audiophiles will turn their nose up at the brand, or the price, whatever, but these speakers blew me away. They have a dedicated central speaker for voices in a movie too, so if you're annoyed when movies have really loud music but quiet speaking tracks, this is a great fix. It's cinematic and impressive. Oh, and video games are fun with it too.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: First Impression
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this to replace my Z501 (I think that was the model anyway) that I purchased in Spring 2006 right after boot camp, so it'll take a while before I can comment on reliability (13 years with no issues before it just died the other day is a hard mark to beat.) Sound quality on these is quite a bit better and with 1k watts (as opposed to the 500 watts of the old system,) I finally have enough power to listen to metal in my 8' x 10' computer room.
customer_reviews.author: N. Neff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speakers
customer_reviews.text: I've been using 5.1 speakers on my desktop for about 17 years. The last set was from so long ago that I can't even remember the brand. I never realized how poor the quality was until I got these setup and start playing music. Excellent range and audio quality for use on my system while listening to music or playing games that support 5.1 sounds. The last set could be mounted directly to the wall behind my desk, these, however, require mountings.
customer_reviews.author: Gene L.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: These worked great until one day: no sound! I turn them on and I hear a light hum then nothing. Really unfortunate because they sounded great until they didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Trudeau

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, Sounds incredible
customer_reviews.text: So easy to hook up to my PS4 PRO just ran a Optical cord from my t.v. to the subwoofer and an HDMI 2.0 cord from my t.v. to my ps4 pro adjusted my t.v and ps4 sound output settings and boom crazy powerful bass and clear vocals and sounds, did the YouTube 5.1 test and passed with flying colors. Would absolutely recommend this system to anyone wanting movie quality sound for a great price
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Great System after my Z-5500 went bad after 16 years!!!
customer_reviews.text: So my z-5500 died after 16 years. It was the Pod, I tried the bypass cable solution not to my liking. So enough of the past. The new z-906 is great it just as loud and crisp as the old one. The base box is smaller but bumps almost as well. I think for a PC this is the best system to get. I give it a 5 star rating!!! I only dislike that I had to buy wall mounts for the speakers, the z-5500 speakers stands swilled and had holes to mount to a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Markakis

customer_reviews.title: Theater quality sound at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Turns my tiny apartment into a theater room. Sounds very good. Easy to use and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewDude

customer_reviews.title: Great System for Gaming, Movies, etc.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone I have over is blown away with the sound that the base creates, and the life-like sound coming from "behind" the couch. Pros: Sound is great, quality/durability of the system is high, command center can connect to different universal remotes, volume range is huge, variety of sound sources sound amazing (game consoles, movies, TV shows) Cons: Remote control with package is perhaps a bit confusing, speakers need to be connected to base via wires (which is incredibly ugly in a lot of rooms), No stands provided for 4 satellite speakers (a must-have for good sound)
customer_reviews.author: Doug Ebersol

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I wanted a decent system for movies, and this exceeded my expectations! Sound is great and clear. I mounted 4. Bass is decent (keep mine at half for now) Surround sound with RCA to projector in my man cave and you made a quality entertainment spot!
customer_reviews.author: GoBlue091812

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding Surround System
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. great sounding system! Having other Logitech systems, I can say that the Z906's are a great step up. Remote control with plenty of options are real nice. Connected to a PC with a high end sound card sounds so nice. Having owned other home speakers, these are great for your multi media PC.
customer_reviews.author: OSCAR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound for such a small setup
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful sound. Really wonderful dynamic audio response. Fantastic Signal to Noise ratio, totally clean of any background noise at all. (Using Optical Cables) When the song stops the system is perfectly quiet. So I can listen at very low volume levels without any distortion or noise. Full support for digital surround protocols, including Dolby and DTS The surround decoder does a really nice up-conversion from Stereo sources up to to 7.1 surround, so even basic stereo music sounds amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Blake A Pritchard

customer_reviews.title: great budget system
customer_reviews.text: Beware the claimed 1000w output rating it is rated at 10% THD, which is a joke of course. Aside from that it has plenty of power and sounds good, but very bass heavy, the subwoofer could use an independent volume control on the speaker itself. If you don't use the optical hookup you can adjust the subwoofer with the equalizer; there may be something I'm missing. I will update the review as I play with it... It's not my Klipsch system but fine for my office computer... It was an easy setup, could use more informative instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Tom X

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING SPEAKERS!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my system for almost 4 years now. Speakers have been dropped, kids have put toys in the sub, spilled drinks and God knows what else on it, and it still works as if it were manufactured yesterday. I see a lot of negative reviews here and i'm really really surprised. I couldn't be happier with the system. Shakes the house when I'm jammin'
customer_reviews.author: dalton

customer_reviews.title: Ad is misleading
customer_reviews.text: The ad is misleading, this is not a surround sound for a television but for a computer
customer_reviews.author: leshanda

customer_reviews.title: avoid this..it has issues
customer_reviews.text: From the word go there had been issue... one of the speakers crackled loudly even at mid volume... now , after a couple of months of use, one of the channels does not output sound and the main unit is stuck on "decode" and I cannot change it. Resetting does nothing...
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Closeout

customer_reviews.title: Clear, big sound...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace an older set of 5.1s I had for over a decade with from Logitech. I like these just as much. There are some changes. The sound is crisper and the bass is deeper on these. I loved my old set but I love this new set just as much. I have had them for a good while now and they are in use just about everyday. No issues. They work and they sound great.
customer_reviews.author: Buuurr

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers
customer_reviews.text: These speakers have been around for a few years. But they sound great and has MEGA BASS. But for the price of them they should come with the mounting brackets and a optic cable. So it cost me a few more bucks to get them. But it was only about $20.00 more for them. If you have a computer with optic on the sound card I would suggest buying the cable at the same time. It makes a big difference in the performance of the 5.1 system.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: fair value, excellent quality and great sound and bass.  this thing does't disappoint .
customer_reviews.text: great quality and great sound, one thing i miss on this thing is the bass adjustment knob but i have found that it is not nessasary because it is so good at producing bass that now i don't miss it that much, i have an earlier model of this brand for the computer bass is awsome one that also so that is why i bought this one, if i buy the optical cable for my tv i will have the 5.1 sound .
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Great sound system!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 18 months ago and have since upgraded the speaker wire and bought an external sound card to take advantage of the optical port since my motherboard onboard sound only has analog connections plus I couldn't get rid of some also interference. I have the other optical port connected to my PS4 and my games sound amazing. I use the RCA ports for my classic gaming systems. Live sports sound fantastic and my Echo Spot is hooked up to it as well. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: R. Cordio

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much from the negative reviews, but this system sounds amazing. It arrived well packaged and heavier than I thought. All of the speakers have a decent weight, so none of the components appeared cheaply made. I purchased this for my computer room and I was so impressed with the sound that I bought another one for my living room. Great sound for a decent price, would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SOUND, need I say more?
customer_reviews.text: These are great speakers and the addition of the remote control makes it easy to control. They also have a nice piece of software called XONAR Audio Center that allows all kinds of adjustment from everything from stereo to 7.1 surround. ### Note ###, I had a great deal of difficulty in Windows 10! You will have to work it out yourself, too lengthy to explain.
customer_reviews.author: Glockman

customer_reviews.title: I expected more.
customer_reviews.text: I brought the Logitech Z906 to be the speaker for my Minix u9 tv box. First off this was delivered in a giantic box be prepared. The Logitech z906 is not worth the money I paid. As far as movie cinema quality it's poor I don't like that you can't turn off certain speakers it's all presets. Now for music playing it shines but for movies I wish I had brought something else and that's how I use it mostly. This is a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Sheva

customer_reviews.title: Great system great price
customer_reviews.text: For a surround system priced in the $300.00 to $400.00 range it is excellent. I use mine for TV and movies (optical) and music (coax). Jets roar, funny cars boom, shots ring and light sabres swoosh. The action is intense. Invest in good cables it is worth the expense. Musically the bass is strong and the surround produces clear mids and highs. Whether rock or Bach both you and your neighbors will be pleased. You won't regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jc22Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using mine with a Sony 4K disk player (HDMI to TV and Coaxial 5.1 audio to the Logitech console), stereo TV sound (Aux port), and RCA audio input from a PC (3 audio sources total). It has great sound, easy audio control (volume and speaker levels) and great frequency response. The bass can rattle the house, if you want it that high. I'll update if anything goes wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well!
customer_reviews.text: My previous sound system for my PC was a Logitech baby brother to the Z906, so I thought I knew what to expect. There is a definite improvement and I thought my old system was good. I mostly game on my PC so gaming sound is as important as music; although, I also listen to music and I especially like to watch BlueRay movies on my PC with my HD monitor so the impact and sound quality is as important as gaming. A very contented happy person here with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jawnTEM

customer_reviews.title: Best compact surround system I've found
customer_reviews.text: The speaker system sounds good, and I like that it can take optical and SPDIF inputs. My biggest complaint is that I can only use one input at a time, so I still need an outboard mixer, which means I can't use the surround sound properly. Still, this a great sound system for computers, game consoles, or just playing some tunes.
customer_reviews.author: TomXP411

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased during prime day for 199.99, I couldn't be happier with this purchase. The system is easy to set up and packs plenty of Bass. Some people are complaining about the 8 inch sub being downgraded in size from the earlier 10 inch model. But let me reassure you that still packs PLENTY of bass. However, those looking for audiophile quality sound may want to look elsewhere. Also at the full retail price of $400 I don't know if this aging unit is worth it at that price point.
customer_reviews.author: Chalkey

customer_reviews.title: Great sound in this price range!
customer_reviews.text: I just got my second set of these speakers for another room. I don’t think you’ll find better sound for the money. Movies are not the same without good speakers like these. Favorite qualities: Very good bass for this price. Optical sound input (as well as others) Easily adjust bass and speaker levels with remote. Space saving unit (no large receiver) I have a custom sound system in my living room, and it does sound better than this system. But the Logitech system is a lot less money. Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: Good power, decent bass
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good cookie cutter speaker system. I really just needed a 2.1 with more power, as I don't want to go through the installation labor for a proper 5.1 layout without cords all over the floor. Just having the rear & front sides together where stereo speakers would be and the console and center speaker together behind the TV, and the subwoofer under the TV in the cabinet, things worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Roberge

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this machine, along with a popcorn maker as we wanted to have family night this year. Have used the surround sound system many, many times since purchasing and remain very happy with it. The set up was easy and the sound is Outstanding! Having the ability to use the remote control is really great. We just played around to find the sound we preferred from each speaker and am now set. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LF

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 4 months, and now the rear speakers don’t work well.
customer_reviews.text: It’s worked well for about 4 months, but now the rear speakers cut out every now and then and I need to take some wires out and put them back in. The bass is great and the speakers worked well for surround sound, but the rear speakers just don’t cut it!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: For the price you will not be disappointed. We got this with the bluetooth adaptor so we can listen to music from our phones and its been awesome. The bass is VERY good. Are there better systems out there?-Yes, but youre gonna have to sell them your leg. I was researching the best system in my budget and everything led to this and i am very very happy with my purchase. i want to buy another one for my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Well for the money for this sounds system, it is well worth it and we are enjoying the sound, we have 2 of these now and my kids 15 & 11 enjoy the sound these speakers put out, the remote is working but my sons had a issue with the batteries not getting power to the unit or something, very minor adjusted them in case where they go and no more issues! Otherwise we are with our Logitech product!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Krock

customer_reviews.title: $$$$$$$$$REALLY IMPRESSED FOR THE PRICE$$$$$$$$$$
customer_reviews.text: Really great sound for the price!!!!! I was going to invest $3000.00 in a Dolby Atmos system and I'm glad I did not!!!! Very easy to use & setup! I have it in my man-cave of 20 'x 12' and it sounds fantastic, plenty loud! The bass is great, sure you can buy bigger but is it needed? M<y understanding the $1100.00 Logitech system you can still buy but the ranges and wattage are not that far off the price dictates!!!!!! Buy these as well!!!!!! Mount-It! MI-SB206 6 Pieces, Universal Full-Motion, Articulating, Audio Media HiFi 5.1 Channel Surround Sound Satellite Speaker Wall or Ceiling Mount Brackets, 1 to 2 Hole Adapters, Black
customer_reviews.author: Craig & Angie

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, BUT Oh so worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I could write a long diatribe about the high quality speakers, the massive Sub and the great control box. Or about the great input sources and the remote control. I just going to say, yeah its expensive. If you are thinking about it just suck it the cost and buy the system. It's totally killer!! Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Paynter

customer_reviews.title: Great entertainment system
customer_reviews.text: Its plenty loud enough, if that's what you are looking for. The subwoofer is pretty dang stout, It may not be a 12 or anything massive, but for my 12-foot by 12-foot room, it was knocking things off my shelves and can be heard in every room of our ~3000 square foot house. But the bass doesn't overpower the rest of the system. You can get more audio clarity from some nice headphones at the same price, but if you just want to lay down and listen to some music or watch a movie, its great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Tate Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: Serious QA issues
customer_reviews.text: One of the speakers the product came with is defective, it only outputs a metallic buzzing sound and higher hz noise. I'm hoping that the process to get it replaced will be painless; I will make sure to update this review as I go along with Logitech's replacement policies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Good With My Television
customer_reviews.text: Did Not Sound Good With My Television. The Sound Was Very Low. Maybe Works Better With Cell Phone Or Computer. I Returned It Immediately. They Gave An Example On YouTube , But Only With A Cell Phone , Not A Television.
customer_reviews.author: RACER ONE

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the system for a few months and I am very happy! For under $300 it sounds super. Movies are great to watch. Lots of bass but still well balanced. Would buy again in a heartbeat
customer_reviews.author: Patrick D.

product_meta.title: Logitech Z906 5.1 Surround Sound Speaker System - THX, Dolby Digital and DTS Digital Certified - Black
product_meta.description: Style:SpeakerLogitech Surround Sound Speaker System Z906. Hear every detail, all around you in theater quality 5.1 sound.
feature_bullets: 5.1 digital surround sound: Hear every detail in your Dolby Digital and DTS soundtracks the way the studio intended. Sub woofer: 165 Watts
THX certified home theater speakers: Your assurance of true cinema quality sound. Satellites : 4 x 67 W, wall mountable
Delivers a continuous 500 watts of power, with the ability to deliver a peak of 1,000 watts under certain circumstances: Thunderous, room shaking audio with deep bass you can feel
Flexible setup: Connect upto six devices : Computer, music player, TV, game console and more; Infared remote
Easy sound control: Compact control console and wireless remote let you instantly personalize your surround sound experience
System Requirements: Works with any device with either a headphone jack (3.5 millimeters), RCA, six channel direct, digital coaxial input or optical inputs. Signal to noise ratio, A weighted: >95dB

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,854 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
